title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department states that several spells of showers will occur in the Northern, North-Central, Eastern, Uva, Central, and North-Western Provinces.

title: Thailand and Cambodia agree to halt fighting, Trump says
byline: US President Donald Trump has said the prime ministers of Thailand and Cambodia will halt fighting “effective this evening”.

title: 26 arrested after police raid drug-fuelled party in Theldeniya
byline: A total of 26 suspects—22 men and four women—were arrested by Theldeniya Police after an illegal “Facebook party” was raided, during which a quantity of illicit narcotics was seized.

title: Parliament to convene on Dec.18 following PM’s request – Speaker
byline: The Parliament of Sri Lanka will convene on 18 December 2025, at 9.30 a.m., Speaker of Parliament Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne announced today (12).

title: Sri Lanka records USD 7.19B remittances in first 11 months of 2025
byline: Sri Lanka recorded USD 673.4 million in workers’ remittances in November 2025, according to data released by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL).

title: US envoy nominee flags China concerns, backs Sri Lanka reforms
byline: American President Donald Trump’s nominee for US ambassador to Sri Lanka told lawmakers that Washington will prioritise maritime security, economic reforms and countering China’s growing footprint in the Indian Ocean nation, as Sri Lanka seeks recovery from its 2022 economic crisis and a devastating cyclone this year.

title: Indian HC briefs Asgiriya, Malwatta chief prelates on cyclone relief efforts
byline: The Indian High Commissioner to Sri Lanka, Santosh Jha, recently paid his respects to the Mahanayake Theros of the Malwatte and Asgiriya Chapters.

title: Sri Lanka, Italy renew bilateral agreement on Mutual Recognition of Driving Licenses
byline: The Government of Sri Lanka and the Government of Italy formally renewed the Bilateral Agreement for the Mutual Recognition of Driving Licences between the two countries yesterday (12) in Rome, Italy.

title: US, Sri Lanka discuss cyclone relief, R&D cooperation & investment opportunities
byline: A discussion recently took place between US Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Julie Chung, and Senior Presidential Advisor on Science and Technology, Professor Gomika Udugamasooriya, at the US Embassy in Colombo.

title: 36 major reservoirs across Sri Lanka continue to spill - Irrigation Dept
byline: The Irrigation Department has reported that 36 major reservoirs and over 46 medium-sized reservoirs across the country are currently spilling, according to Director of Irrigation (Water Management) H.M.P.S.D. Herath.

title: Govt plans compensation or land allocation for people in landslide-hit areas
byline: The Land Commissioner General’s Department (LCGD) has initiated measures to conduct a survey of lands affected by Cyclone Ditwah, with particular attention to areas impacted by landslides in Sri Lanka.

title: Nobel Peace Prize committee condemns “brutal” arrest of Iranian laureate Narges Mohammadi
byline: Iranian human rights activist and Nobel Peace Prize laureate Narges Mohammadi was arrested in a “brutal” manner in Iran and must be released immediately, the Norwegian Nobel Committee, which awards the prize, said on Friday.

title: Authorities aim to clear flood-generated waste in Colombo suburbs within 10 days
byline: The Chairman of the Central Environmental Authority (CEA), Thilak Hewawasam, stated that authorities expect to completely remove accumulated garbage in the flood-affected suburbs of Colombo, following Cyclone Ditwah, within approximately 10 days.

title: Thailand vows to keep fighting Cambodia, despite Trump’s ceasefire claim
byline: Thailand’s leader vowed to keep fighting on the disputed border with Cambodia as fighter jets struck targets on Saturday, hours after U.S. President Donald Trump said he had brokered a ceasefire.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for severe lightning in the Kalutara, Ratnapura, Galle and Matara Districts.

title: Chilaw General Hospital flood damage exceeds Rs. 1,200M: Minister
byline: The Minister of Health and Mass Media, Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa, stated that the Chilaw General Hospital, which was affected by recent flooding in Sri Lanka, has sustained damages exceeding Rs. 1,200 million.

title: Over 13,500 businesses affected by adverse weather - Ministry
byline: The Ministry of Industry and Enterprise Development has reported that the Industry Disaster Support Center (IDSC) has received data on 13,698 businesses affected by the recent adverse weather conditions in Sri Lanka.

title: Special festive advance granted to public officials
byline: A circular has been issued to provide a special advance payment of up to Rs. 4,000 to public officials in view of the festive season.

title: Israel kills senior Hamas commander in Gaza strike, Israeli media say
byline: The Israeli military killed senior Hamas commander Raed Saed, one of the architects of the October 7, 2023, attacks on Israel, in a strike on a car in Gaza City on Saturday, several Israeli media outlets reported, citing sources.

title: President directs officials to prioritize rebuilding livelihoods of disaster-affected communities
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has instructed officials to give top priority to restoring the livelihoods of communities affected by the disaster.

title: Ministry urges public to avoid sharing details of disaster-affected children
byline: The Ministry of Women and Child Affairs has urged all parties to refrain from disseminating any information related to children who have become vulnerable due to the recent disaster situation in the country.

title: Somawathiya-Sungavila road to be closed again
byline: Steps have been taken to temporarily close the Somawathiya-Sungavila main road once again.

title: Over Rs. 13 bln disbursed by Treasury so far to provide disaster relief – Finance Secretary
byline: The Secretary to the Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development, Dr. Harshana Suriyapperuma, says that the Treasury has so far disbursed more than Rs. 13 billion to provide relief to the people affected by the disaster situation.

title: Iran seizes oil tanker carrying illegal fuel, Sri Lankans among 18 crew members – report
byline: Iran has seized an oil tanker in the Gulf of Oman, Iranian media said overnight Friday to Saturday, adding that 18 crew members from India, Sri Lanka and Bangladesh were on board.

title: Steps underway to promptly reopen Hakgala Botanical Garden
byline: Deputy Minister of Environment Anton Jayakody participated in an inspection visit to initiate measures to reopen the Hakgala Botanical Garden promptly, which has been temporarily closed due to the disaster situation caused by Cyclone Ditwah in the country.
